intro: Horkelia congesta subsp. typica, commonly known as the clustered horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in dry, rocky soils. It is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes.
